CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Business?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Business is arc {Engineering}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Social Sciences?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Social Sciences is arc {Arts}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Social Sciences} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Business to Engineering in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Arts to Engineering in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Engineering and Arts in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Engineering and Arts is {89}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Arts and Engineering in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Arts and Engineering is {75}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Arts?
SC.A: The total flow output from Arts is {351}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Business?
SC.A: The total flow input by Business is {752}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 216? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {231} from {Social Sciences} to {Business}, a flow of {230} from {Business} to {Social Sciences}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 82? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {75} from {Engineering} to {Arts}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 125 and 167? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {159} from {Business} to {Computer Science}, a flow of {143} from {Arts} to {Business}, a flow of {132} from {Business} to {Arts}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Engineering to Business or from Engineering to Arts?
NC.A: The flow from {Engineering} to {Business} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Business to Engineering, from Arts to Business, or from Arts to Computer Science?
NC.A: The flow from {Business} to {Engineering} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Arts}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Business} and {Social Sciences}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Engineering, Arc Business, Arc Social Sciences, Arc Arts, Arc Computer Science}.
